title: UX design for a location based mobile application - Upwork
description: UX Design for a mobile application for exploring archaeological sites. Project Overview: An iOS app to help users discover and explore archaeological sites. Candidate requirements: - Proven experience in mobile app UX design, particularly for iOS. - Solid understanding of usability principles applied in mobile contexts. - Someone who appreciates the subtlety of user-centered design and is not inclined to overcomplicate interfaces with unnecessary features. - A designer who understands that this app is about enhancing the user’s real-world experience, not about keeping them glued to their screens (no gamification, no dark-patterns) - An individual who recognises the importance of privacy and user autonomy, hence will not insist on unnecessary logins or accounts when designing the app interface. - Ideally, familiarity with the Apple Human-Interface Guidelines. Responsibilities: - Create straightforward, effective designs for varied outdoor use cases (navigating by road, walking across uneven terrain etc.) - Collaborate with me to refine the user experience based on actual usage and feedback. - Regularly review and adapt designs to ensure clarity and user-friendliness. Expected Deliverables: - Initial wireframes and design justifications. - High-fidelity UI design, typographic specifications, and color schemes suitable for outdoor viewing. Note: This app aims to be a public good and will be free of charge i.e. no monetisation related features desired. The candidate will need to demonstrate examples of what I'm looking for.Skills: Interaction Design, Human-Centered Design, Style Guide, User Flow, iOS, User Experience Design, Wireframing, Mobile App Design, Mobile UI Design, User Interface Design

title: `design Employee profile with configuration option - Upwork
description: For a SaaS system, we require to design Employee profile with a configuration facility: Employee Profile: The employee profile should be able to extract relevant employee data from various sources, such as HR management systems, payroll systems, performance management systems and Recruitment management systems. A. Data mapping: It should be able to map the extracted data to the appropriate fields in the employee profile section, ensuring that the data is accurately and consistently represented. B. Real-time updates: The employee profile integration should be able to update the employee profile system in real time as changes are made to the underlying data sources, ensuring that the employee profile remains up-to-date and accurate. C. Customization: The employee profile should allow for customization of the employee profile fields and layout to meet the specific needs of each organization. D. Security: The employee profile should be designed with security in mind, ensuring that employee data is protected and that access is restricted to fields’ level to authorized personnel. E. Data validation: The employee profile integration should be able to validate the data being entered into the employee profile system, ensuring that it meets the required format and that any required fields are completed. F. Reporting: The employee profile should be able to generate reports on employee data, such as headcount, turnover, and diversity metrics, providing valuable insights to the organization. G. User interface: The employee profile should have a user-friendly interface that allows for easy navigation and data entry, ensuring that employees and HR personnel can effectively use the system. H. Audit trail: The employee profile integration should maintain an audit trail of changes made to employee data, allowing for easy tracking of changes and accountability. I. Scalability: The employee profile should be scalable to accommodate changes in the size of the organization, ensuring that it can handle increasing amounts of employee data as the organization grows. J. Compliance: The employee profile integration should comply with relevant laws and regulations, such as data privacy regulations, to ensure that employee data is protected and handled in accordance with legal requirements. K. Workflow automation: Automation can be used to automate workflows related to the employee profile integration process, such as approval workflows or notification workflows. This can save time and ensure that the process flows smoothly. L. Error handling: can be used to identify and handle errors that may occur during the process, such as missing or invalid data. can be used to automate the process of identifying and handling errors, reducing the risk of errors and ensuring that the employee profile is accurate and complete. M. Mobile support: it should support mobile devices, allowing for the creation and management of workflows from anywhere, at any time. N.   Employee Profile content examples: - Personal information: This includes the employee's name, address, contact information, and other relevant personal details. - Employment information: This includes the employee's job title, department, start date, employment status, and other relevant employment details. - Compensation information: This includes the employee's salary, bonuses, benefits, and other relevant compensation details. - Performance information: This includes the employee's performance ratings, goals, and other relevant performance-related information. - Training and development information: This includes the employee's training history, development plans, and other relevant learning-related information. - Career information: This includes the employee's career aspirations, development opportunities, and other relevant career-related information. - Compliance information: This includes the employee's compliance training history, certifications, and other relevant compliance-related information. - Diversity and inclusion information: This includes the employee's diversity and inclusion data, such as gender, race, ethnicity, and other relevant demographic information. - Emergency contact information: This includes the employee's emergency contact information, such as the name and contact details of their next of kin. - Other relevant information: This includes any other relevant information about the employee that may be required for organizational purposes, such as security clearances or special accommodations.Skills: Web Design, PHP, JavaScript
